metadata.title: CVE-2018-10873 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was discovered in SPICE before version 0.14.1 where the generated code used for demarshalling messages lacked sufficient bounds checks. A malicious client or server, after authentication, could send specially crafted messages to its peer which would result in a crash or, potentially, other impacts.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2018-10873` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libspice-server1 - 0.14.0-1ubuntu4
No subscription required

gir1.2-spiceclientglib-2.0 - 0.35-2
gir1.2-spiceclientgtk-3.0 - 0.35-2
libspice-client-glib-2.0-8 - 0.35-2
libspice-client-gtk-3.0-5 - 0.35-2
spice-client-glib-usb-acl-helper - 0.35-2
spice-client-gtk - 0.35-2
No subscription required

notes.note: leosilva> for xenial this bug is affected in spice-protocol only.

criterions.comment: spice package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.14.0-1ubuntu4').
spice-gtk package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.35-2').
